import Mathlib

open Finset

/-- The Cauchy product of two sequences a and b. -/
def cauchy_product {Î± : Type _} [NonUnitalRing Î±] (a b : â„• â†’ Î±) (n : â„•) : Î± :=
  âˆ‘ m in range (n + 1), a m * b (n - m)

/-- Show that the Cauchy product of two absolutely convergent series is absolutely convergent,
    and its sum equals the product of the sums. -/
theorem cauchy_product_of_absolutely_summable {Î± : Type _} [NormedRing Î±] {a b : â„• â†’ Î±}
  (ha : Summable fun n => â€–a nâ€–) (hb : Summable fun n => â€–b nâ€–) :
  Summable (fun n => â€–cauchy_product a b nâ€–) âˆ§ (âˆ‘' n, cauchy_product a b n) = (âˆ‘' n, a n) * (âˆ‘' n, b n) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Finset

/-- The Cauchy product of two sequences a and b (real-valued). -/
def cauchy_product (a b : â„• â†’ â„) (n : â„•) : â„ :=
  âˆ‘ m in Finset.range (n + 1), a m * b (n - m)

/-- The Cauchy product of two absolutely convergent real series is absolutely convergent,
    and its sum equals the product of the sums. -/
theorem cauchy_product_of_absolutely_summable {a b : â„• â†’ â„}
  (ha : Summable fun n => |a n|) (hb : Summable fun n => |b n|) :
  Summable (fun n => |cauchy_product a b n|) âˆ§ (âˆ‘' n, cauchy_product a b n) = (âˆ‘' n, a n) * (âˆ‘' n, b n) := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Finset

/-- The Cauchy product of two sequences a and b (real-valued). -/
def my_cauchy_product (a b : â„• â†’ â„) (n : â„•) : â„ :=
  Finset.sum (range (n + 1)) fun m => a m * b (n - m)

/-- The Cauchy product of two absolutely convergent real series is absolutely convergent,
    and its sum equals the product of the sums. -/
theorem cauchy_product_of_absolutely_summable {a b : â„• â†’ â„}
  (ha : Summable fun n => |a n|) (hb : Summable fun n => |b n|) :
  Summable (fun n => |my_cauchy_product a b n|) âˆ§ (âˆ‘' n, my_cauchy_product a b n) = (âˆ‘' n, a n) * (âˆ‘' n, b n) := by
  sorry
